title: Building chap package.py file
body:
Trying to create the package.py file for the chap application (Channel Annotation Package) and have a few questions.
Read the documentation at [https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_systems/cmakepackage.html] since chap uses Cmake.

First built chap using ubuntu under WSL for windows using the instructions at [https://github.com/channotation/chap]. In the build process,
it produces a CMakeCache.txt file (attached) that lists the cmake variables. I also looked at the package.py file for gromacs as a reference.

based on the CMakeCache.txt, these are the relevant include, cmake and libraries for the dependencies.

```
BLAS_LIB:FILEPATH= ~spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0netlib-lapack-3.8.0-vckewhbc34ctczacjac2hmjlvls6ni32/lib/libblas.so
Boost_INCLUDE_DIR:PATH= ~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/boost-1.75.0-vfj3o276vbhmsg3dhxbsiqw7zkxxiou4/include
CBLAS_LIB:FILEPATH= ~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/netlib-lapack-3.8.0-vckewhbc34ctczacjac2hmjlvls6ni32/lib/libcblas.so
GROMACS_DIR:PATH= ~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/gromacs-2020.4-64mf7gccw43hkzl6paasgxzjq4myuzak/share/cmake/gromacs
LAPACKE_CBLAS_INCLUDE_DIR:PATH= ~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/netlib-lapack-3.8.0-vckewhbc34ctczacjac2hmjlvls6ni32/include
LAPACKE_LAPACKE_INCLUDE_DIR:PATH= ~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/netlib-lapack-3.8.0-vckewhbc34ctczacjac2hmjlvls6ni32/include
LAPACKE_LIB:FILEPATH=~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/netlib-lapack-3.8.0-vckewhbc34ctczacjac2hmjlvls6ni32/lib/liblapacke.so
LAPACK_LIB:FILEPATH=~/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-ivybridge/gcc-7.5.0/netlib-lapack-3.8.0-vckewhbc34ctczacjac2hmjlvls6ni32/lib/liblapack.so
```
[CMakeCache.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5804029/CMakeCache.txt)
Since they are include and cmake directories, and libraries found in the dependencies does spack take care of finding them or do they need to be set in the
package.py file for chap as an option? Is it sufficient to build with 'netlib-lapack' and not use 'openblas' since openblas and lapack provides('blas') and provides('lapack')?
